OOG.content: in going out from self to self of the Absolute of Living Present present, intentionality is the root of historicity, historicity is sense
OOG.linkedContent: in going out from self to self of the Absolute of Living Present present, intentionality is the root of historicity, historicity is sense

GT.content: condition common to gift & event: unconditionality > chance, tukhē, in an instant, disorder, surprise, irruptive, unmotivated, freedom of dice throw, coup de don, obey nothing but disorder, principles w/out principles, not necessary, gratuitous, déchirer la trame
GT.linkedContent: condition common to gift & event: unconditionality > chance, tukhē, in an instant, disorder, surprise, irruptive, unmotivated, freedom of dice throw, coup de don, obey nothing but disorder, principles w/out principles, not necessary, gratuitous, déchirer la trame

GT.content: one must intend to give a gift, and yet all intentionality threatens the gift w/ self-keeping > intentional freedom & chance must miraculously agree w/ each other
GT.linkedContent: one must intend to give a gift, and yet all intentionality threatens the gift w/ self-keeping > intentional freedom & chance must miraculously agree w/ each other

HERP.content: can we read an “unconscious” affinity btwn impending arrival of friend and imminence of death? [Heidegger would protest—isn’t analytic of Dasein regulated by norms of absolute intentional meaning?]
HERP.linkedContent: can we read an “unconscious” affinity btwn impending arrival of friend and imminence of death? [Heidegger would protest—isn’t analytic of Dasein regulated by norms of absolute intentional meaning?]

VM.content: isn’t intentionality respect itself? the other appearing as other for the same?
VM.linkedContent: isn’t intentionality respect itself? the other appearing as other for the same?

VM.content: would return to intentional phenomenon acquiesce to violence of fact, is there thus an irreducible zone of factuality, an original, transcendental, preethical violence? > would it be tied to phenomenality itself & possibility of language? embedded in root of meaning & logos
VM.linkedContent: would return to intentional phenomenon acquiesce to violence of fact, is there thus an irreducible zone of factuality, an original, transcendental, preethical violence? > would it be tied to phenomenality itself & possibility of language? embedded in root of meaning & logos

VP.content: intentionality in every expression explains Derrida’s choice of vouloir-dire for Bedeutung
VP.linkedContent: intentionality in every expression explains Derrida’s choice of vouloir-dire for Bedeutung

VP.content: despite passive genesis, Husserl’s intentionality is still taken in tradition of metaphysical voluntarism
VP.linkedContent: despite passive genesis, Husserl’s intentionality is still taken in tradition of metaphysical voluntarism

VP.content: everything indicative, empirical, everything that physically incarnates expression, is foreign to expressivity, to pure intention
VP.linkedContent: everything indicative, empirical, everything that physically incarnates expression, is foreign to expressivity, to pure intention

VP.content: difference btwn indication and expression is functional or intentional not substantial
VP.linkedContent: difference btwn indication and expression is functional or intentional not substantial

VP.content: Derrida notes uniqueness of Husserl’s division between intuition and intentionality, that the “fulfilling” intuition is not essential to the expression, to the intention of meaning: this allows for a pure logical grammar: absence of object is not absence of meaning
VP.linkedContent: Derrida notes uniqueness of Husserl’s division between intuition and intentionality, that the “fulfilling” intuition is not essential to the expression, to the intention of meaning: this allows for a pure logical grammar: absence of object is not absence of meaning

VP.content: [now] in presence (of object), intentionality and intuition fuse [?], and its structure disappears, can they ever be fused in intentional meaning can function w/out intuition [?]
VP.linkedContent: [now] in presence (of object), intentionality and intuition fuse [?], and its structure disappears, can they ever be fused in intentional meaning can function w/out intuition [?]

VP.content: Husserl’s contradiction: “I” must always be new but doesn’t ideal nature of Bedeutung exclude the “always new” > Derrida uses Husserl’s logic against him, explaining that we understand “I,” even when “I am dead,” because intention does not require intuition
VP.linkedContent: Husserl’s contradiction: “I” must always be new but doesn’t ideal nature of Bedeutung exclude the “always new” > Derrida uses Husserl’s logic against him, explaining that we understand “I,” even when “I am dead,” because intention does not require intuition

T.content: Marges concerns relevance of limit, a reading of the Hegelian Aufhebung, a reading beyond Hegel’s own intention, beyond that which is inscribed on the internal vestibule of his ear, where Hegel’s text would be a writing machine of “conscious intention,” thus a mechanical reader
T.linkedContent: Marges concerns relevance of limit, a reading of the Hegelian Aufhebung, a reading beyond Hegel’s own intention, beyond that which is inscribed on the internal vestibule of his ear, where Hegel’s text would be a writing machine of “conscious intention,” thus a mechanical reader

OTO.content: [re: fact that Nazis could ape Nietzsche’s text] if you refuse conscious, deliberate textual intentions, the perversion is made possible by structure of text itself (its “remaining”), otherwise it would be unreadable > nothing absolutely contingent about fact that Nazis effectively brandished his name [Derrida wary of close reading that would preserve Nietzsche’s intention]
OTO.linkedContent: [re: fact that Nazis could ape Nietzsche’s text] if you refuse conscious, deliberate textual intentions, the perversion is made possible by structure of text itself (its “remaining”), otherwise it would be unreadable > nothing absolutely contingent about fact that Nazis effectively brandished his name [Derrida wary of close reading that would preserve Nietzsche’s intention]

GSP.content: unlike noema, hylē is real but not intentional, sensate material of affect before intentional form, pure passivity, w/out which consciousness could not receive anything but itself, an essential opening > as temporal matter, wouldn’t it be possibility of genesis itself? irreducible complicity of time/other call “principle of principle” into question
GSP.linkedContent: unlike noema, hylē is real but not intentional, sensate material of affect before intentional form, pure passivity, w/out which consciousness could not receive anything but itself, an essential opening > as temporal matter, wouldn’t it be possibility of genesis itself? irreducible complicity of time/other call “principle of principle” into question

FS.content: [for deconstruction] history of the work is not only its past, it is the impossibility of the text ever being present > legitimating intention keeps to internal truth, avoids thinking a subjective origin that is not simply psychological/mental
FS.linkedContent: [for deconstruction] history of the work is not only its past, it is the impossibility of the text ever being present > legitimating intention keeps to internal truth, avoids thinking a subjective origin that is not simply psychological/mental

HLP.content: what a [classical] lie does: address to another, intentional act, consciousness, presence-to-self of knowledge > lying a betrayal of contract & duty to other [classical lie presumes MOP]
HLP.linkedContent: what a [classical] lie does: address to another, intentional act, consciousness, presence-to-self of knowledge > lying a betrayal of contract & duty to other [classical lie presumes MOP]

HLP.content: intention to lie pertains to saying & meaning to say (vouloir-dire)—not to the said
HLP.linkedContent: intention to lie pertains to saying & meaning to say (vouloir-dire)—not to the said

HLP.content: St. Augustines’s lie is a labyrinth where one can take a wrong turn at any step: will, intentionality of consciousness, desire/will to deceive (fallendi cupiditas, voluntas fallendi)
HLP.linkedContent: St. Augustines’s lie is a labyrinth where one can take a wrong turn at any step: will, intentionality of consciousness, desire/will to deceive (fallendi cupiditas, voluntas fallendi)

EL.content: tautological & contradictory logic (speaks of the event of an impossible, makes of impossible the condition of possibility): secularization allows us to speak of a secularization that doesn’t take place
EL.linkedContent: tautological & contradictory logic (speaks of the event of an impossible, makes of impossible the condition of possibility): secularization allows us to speak of a secularization that doesn’t take place

LI.content: Derrida does not impose a clean break w/ intention but calls into question its telos, its fulfillment, its actualization in a plenitude that would be present to & identical w/ itself
LI.linkedContent: Derrida does not impose a clean break w/ intention but calls into question its telos, its fulfillment, its actualization in a plenitude that would be present to & identical w/ itself

LI.content: intention is differing/deferring in its inception
LI.linkedContent: intention is differing/deferring in its inception

LI.content: differing/deferring effects intention & object thus aimed at (signified/referent)
LI.linkedContent: differing/deferring effects intention & object thus aimed at (signified/referent)

LI.content: plenitude of intentional meaning (vouloir-dire), meaningfulness, consciousness, presence, originary intuition > all organize phenomenology [what Derrida is questioning]
LI.linkedContent: plenitude of intentional meaning (vouloir-dire), meaningfulness, consciousness, presence, originary intuition > all organize phenomenology [what Derrida is questioning]

LI.content: [from SEC] structural unconsciousness, absence of intending actual utterance, prohibits any saturation of context (total presence)
LI.linkedContent: [from SEC] structural unconsciousness, absence of intending actual utterance, prohibits any saturation of context (total presence)

LI.content: [re: conforming to code, grammaticality] a minimum making-sense is incommensurate w/ adequate understanding of intended meaning > this incommensurability is irreducible, “inheres” in intention itself, riven (creusé) w/ iterability
LI.linkedContent: [re: conforming to code, grammaticality] a minimum making-sense is incommensurate w/ adequate understanding of intended meaning > this incommensurability is irreducible, “inheres” in intention itself, riven (creusé) w/ iterability

LI.content: expressionist & representationalist description of language: intention adequate to, realizes, expression (dehiscence is there even before divide btwn intention/expression)
LI.linkedContent: expressionist & representationalist description of language: intention adequate to, realizes, expression (dehiscence is there even before divide btwn intention/expression)

LI.content: “primary masochism” [a wolf of undecidability] poisons, how can one identify the intention, the speaker, the effect once border btwn pleasure/pain is upset?
LI.linkedContent: “primary masochism” [a wolf of undecidability] poisons, how can one identify the intention, the speaker, the effect once border btwn pleasure/pain is upset?

LI.content: thus the limited responsibility of Sarl, vulnerable to parasitisms, the “conscious ego” cannot incorporate and does its best to exclude [despite Derrida’s vehemence, substituting Sarl for Searle demonstrates his uncanny generosity—he will not accuse a subject]
LI.linkedContent: thus the limited responsibility of Sarl, vulnerable to parasitisms, the “conscious ego” cannot incorporate and does its best to exclude [despite Derrida’s vehemence, substituting Sarl for Searle demonstrates his uncanny generosity—he will not accuse a subject]

LI.content: speech act theory seeks the founding categories of all ethical-political statements: relation of intentionality to conventionality or to rules (in the best Kantian tradition)
LI.linkedContent: speech act theory seeks the founding categories of all ethical-political statements: relation of intentionality to conventionality or to rules (in the best Kantian tradition)

LI.content: iterability doesn’t limit intentionality in general but its consciousness, its presence to itself
LI.linkedContent: iterability doesn’t limit intentionality in general but its consciousness, its presence to itself

LI.content: telos of “fulfillment” (in this I believe Husserl was right) is not accidental, separable from concept of intentionality—conditions it [cf. p. 56 is there disingenuousness here?]
LI.linkedContent: telos of “fulfillment” (in this I believe Husserl was right) is not accidental, separable from concept of intentionality—conditions it [cf. p. 56 is there disingenuousness here?]

LI.content: this telos, a “longing for metaphysical plenitude,” can be lived/described w/out romantic, even mystical pathos sometimes associated w/ these words
LI.linkedContent: this telos, a “longing for metaphysical plenitude,” can be lived/described w/out romantic, even mystical pathos sometimes associated w/ these words

LI.content: for Searle, “realization” signifies “actualization” or “fulfillment”: “serious/literal” are exemplary qualities of idealized realization of intention, what language ought to do
LI.linkedContent: for Searle, “realization” signifies “actualization” or “fulfillment”: “serious/literal” are exemplary qualities of idealized realization of intention, what language ought to do

LI.content: plenitude is telos, but structure of this telos is such that attainment = death/paralysis > thus, telos divided/split, this non-end not an extraneous vestige but most intimate and irreducible other in intentionality; plenitude orients and endangers intention [“dispossessed of long-for presence…”]
LI.linkedContent: plenitude is telos, but structure of this telos is such that attainment = death/paralysis > thus, telos divided/split, this non-end not an extraneous vestige but most intimate and irreducible other in intentionality; plenitude orients and endangers intention [“dispossessed of long-for presence…”]

LI.content: non-end lasts wherever there’s life, language, intention, mark, finite infinite of differance
LI.linkedContent: non-end lasts wherever there’s life, language, intention, mark, finite infinite of differance

LI.content: iterability not merely a law of intentionality, though it introduces the structural limit of its telos > Derrida distrusts figure of intention, which grows increasingly obscure [Derrida not in “conflict” w/ intentionality, just observes limit to its telos > intentionality no more telos than arché]
LI.linkedContent: iterability not merely a law of intentionality, though it introduces the structural limit of its telos > Derrida distrusts figure of intention, which grows increasingly obscure [Derrida not in “conflict” w/ intentionality, just observes limit to its telos > intentionality no more telos than arché]

E.content: rhetoric often compared to a machine, because there’s no intention inside > false life, empty symbolism of these sophistical tekhnai
E.linkedContent: rhetoric often compared to a machine, because there’s no intention inside > false life, empty symbolism of these sophistical tekhnai

AD.content: for Levinas, hospitality is an intentionality that resists thematization
AD.linkedContent: for Levinas, hospitality is an intentionality that resists thematization
